div.p: THE Word of the Lord TO HIS CHURCH AND Holy Assembly Regenerated and born again of the righteous Seed, which the Lord hath blessed.
To whom this is sent to be carefully and distinctly read, in the fear of the Lord, when they are met together, in the Light of the Covenant of the most High God.
Blessed, yea for ever blessed are they whose Names are written in the Lambs Book of Life.

div.head: The Word of the Lord to his Church, &c.
div.p:
DEar precious Brethren and Sisters, in the ever honourable, peaceable birth of the Seed immortal, which the Lord hath blessed; grace, mercy, and peace be multiplyed amongst you in the aboundings of the enlarged mercies of our Lord Jesus Christ; in whom feel the flowings of the bowels of your brother, whose life with all the relations and enjoyments of this world hath been and is freely given up to serve you. Dear breathing, hungry and thirsty babes of my heavenly Father. Oh the deep of his compassions that opens in my heart to you; Children, Immortal, born again, in which bowels of tender love I exhort you all diligently to watch to the heavenly attendancies of the spirit of life, in the Covenant of Light, in the Lord our Righteousness, that you may all feel his mighty power condemning sin in the flesh, and quicken your spirits, to live and reign through faith in his name, that over the accuser of the Brethren you may stand and never more to be bowed down, as some of you have been in years past, through the mysterious working of the evil attendancies of your minds, in which you will read me in what I write: for you that fear the Lord, & watch to his light, you have a clear discovery in the true sensibility of what is good, and what is evil, and hear you have learned your condemnation; but some that come forth with us after a regulation of their conversations in some outward observations according to the light, for want of watchfulness, are drawn by the mystery of iniquity, and so go from us to rest in what they have done, and delights their hearts in the knowledge more then the life that gives the knowledge, and thus they eat the forbidden fruit, and what ever is pretended in the service of God there is self-endedness in every undertaking, and under the fainedst humi • ity, a self-priding spirit is found, as it is written, I deck thee with my jewels, but thou took my jewels and played the harlot, and decked thy self; and these are they that run and busies themselves to be helpful in the work of the Lord, whom
the Lord never sent; and though they may conceit themselves they do a great deal of good, and say in their own hearts I am wise and rich, and sees, and wants nothing, which in the tast of the imm • rtal birth, which tast all things as it really is, they are known to be blind, na • ed, and miserable, and want all things, and so is manifest that God never sent them; therefore do they not profit the people at all; and if they turn not to the light to wait for God to destroy the self-priding spirit in the gifted man, that the birth may reign that makes self of no reputation, but they abide where they are to feed of the tree of knowledge, of good and evil, from whence rises strife and contentions, then shall they assuredly perish as the glory of the flower of the field, and be consumed as the withering grass, and shall be extinguished as the wandering Stars, which fall down to the Earth, whose luster and glory shall be seen no more; f • r the Lord will dry up the tongue of the Egiptian sea, and all intruding births that offer up a sacrifice before the Lord, which burdens the Children of the Royal seed: what is before written it shall come upon them, the mouth of the Lord hath spoken it to my great joy. And all you dear Lambs of the Lord God Almighty, who delights to hear the living voice of the spirit of the most high God amongst his people, that so you may have the bread of life broken to you for which you hunger, and untill you have it, your sorrows is known unto the Lord, &c. and to with-hold you from the enjoyment of what you hunger, for great is the wrath of the enemy as before written, as he leads some to their own destruction in a self-priding spirit in outward observation, so doth he seek to destroy the innocent babes by his temptations and his secret and private accusations, where he continually seeks to add affliction to the afflicted, who live in the deep sence of their own misery, notwithstanding all their obedience with life to death, untill they be sealed up with the holy spirit of promise in the free mercies of God in the Covevant of Light in the Lord, thereto be established in the marriage uni • n with Christ our Righteousness for ever: And seeing you dear Lambs that abhors every evil way in love to the Lord, who manif • steth his light which reacheth the sensitive part, God in his Eternal Wisdom to hide pride from Man, and that not any should boast and say stand by I am holier then thou, that all may be buried in the sence of their own misery, therefore hath he hid
our life with Christ in God, that all his Children may lie prostrate before the throne of his Grace, and free mercy there to wait till he reveal the life to satisfie the soul according to the desire raised up in the light; but oh dear Lambs how d • th the accuser rage and takes his advantage when you do not feel the life as sencibly satisfying your thirst, as you are sensible in the Light what you thirst for; oh how doth the accuser bow you down to undervalue what the Lord hath done for you, and cause you to look constantly at your own weakness, and at the temptations you meet with all, and often accuses you that few is like unto you, and that you will never be able to get over those besetments and evil attendancies of your minds; and hear many lies mourning in secret, bearing many heavy burdens through he •• kening to the accuser who violently assaults you, and accuses you day and night before the throne of God, and when any sparklings of the glory of the quickening spirit is manifest in you to raise you up to believe in the name of Christ, where your life is hid: Then the Accuser in great fury strikes you down and bids you take heed of presuming, there is no such thing belongs to you as yet, you must see such and such things overcome before you can expect such attainments of the free mercy of the Lord: thus doth the enemy chain you in darkness, and draws you into a self-striving spirit, where many strives to enter the Kingdom, and enters not, for without Faith there is no entrance, neither is it possible to please God; therefore all Children born Immortal, you can understand me in this matter, for unto you this is directed in the simpathizing spirit, where your burdens is mine, and your sorrows is my sorrows, when I behold how the enemy chains you down, and how the red Dragon in the greatness of his rage is ready to devour the tender birth, which hath no life but in the Righteousness of God in Christ, the sence of your exercises, weights and burdens, causes mine eyes to be as a fountain of tears to water the Altar of God, when I approach the throne of his Grace, in the sensibility of all your misery to wrestle with the Lord my God in the st • ength of the life, which hath delivered my soul out of the thraldom where you are bound, and the Lord is prevailed withal for you, and he hath commanded me in the word of his faithfulness in this day, that his spirit is poured upon me, to preach the Gospel to you that is poor in your spirits, and to entreat and beseech you to judge
sin, and self, and lend not your ears to the accuser, or to any evil attendancy that would hinder you as little Children to enter the Kingdom, or for looking up in the light to lay hold on the life through faith in the name which in the unlimited power and soul saving sanctifying spirit of the Lord Jesus, which will supply all your wants, for he is as free to save you as he is to convince you, of the need of his Salvation: Oh the Lord perswade you of the truth of these words that I may be eased in the travel of my soul for you, who st • nd mourning at a distance, and will not come that you may have life: oh be entreated in true watchfulness, in the light, to judg all your doubts, thoughts, fearfulness, and unbelief, and what ever would hinder you, from laying hold of the soul-saving Power, of the Lord of Life: Oh let not the locks of the beloved, be any more bedewed with the drops of the night; which is your doubts, and resistances of his love, but all you necessitated people, that are born of the Seed, that cannot live without the Light of the Countenance of God; and in the secret of your hearts, abhors all self-seeking, and self-serving, that you may serve the Lord in uprightness; is the pressure of your spirits; and your dayly breathings unto the Lord: Oh open your eares, and hear the Proclamation, from the Throne of the Glory, of the unlimited love, and mercy of the God of your Salvation; who hath commanded me once more, in the demonstration and power of his spirit, to exhort yee all, in the light of his own Covenant to come away, to the Fountain of life; let not the excusing Man be hearkned unto in this day of Gods invitation; but every one in the sense of your necessities draw near; and look all to the God of living mercy; for as the Serpent was lift up in the Wilderness, so is the Son of Man lifted up this day; therefore come away, come away; in the simplisity of your spirits; and resign freely to be orde • ed by him, who saith who ever comes unto me, I will in no wise cast off, and he will cure you, of all your maladies; he will cause the lame to leap, and you that hath been blind, to see his love extending unto you; and he will bind up your broken hea • ts; and he will comfort the mourners in Sion; and he will lift up the bowed down heads; and he will consolate the afflicted, and set free the Captives; and he will wash the stains off all your Garments; and he will dry up all the Ishues, that hath putrified, and will cause the dumb to speak, and the solitary
to sing the high praises of our God; he will be the Husband of the desolate Widdow; and an entertainer of the stranger; in his great distresses; and a Father he will be, to the immortal birth, that hath no comfort, but in his presence; therefore I beseech you, and dearly entreat you, who hath any sensibleness upon your spirits, of the need of the help of the Lord, our God: Oh stand not at a distance, in unbelief; oh be perswaded to commit your souls and bodies to the orderings of the Lord Jesus; where your help is laid up for you, and all that truly wait and believe in his Light, and Life, shall see, the Windowes of Heaven opened; and the Sluces of the River of pleasure drawn; and the Flood-gates of mercy set wide; that every one that's born again, may find more strength, life, soul-saving power, joy, and peace, in the Light and Covenant of Life, in the Lord Jesus, then there is strength in the power of Darkness, to draw us from him. Therefore dear Brethren and Sisters, be not doubtful, be not doubtful, but believe, over, above, and beyond, all whatever appeares within, or without, that would draw you from your stedfast standing in the Light, Power, and Life of Jesus; that so through faith, in his name, you may say to the Mountaines, be removed, and it shall be so; yea in this faith, resist the Devil, he will fly away, and you shall tread down Sathan, and trample upon all wicked thoughts, and evil attendancies of your mindes, as ashes under the soales of your feet, yea the accuser of the Brethren, that accused you, before the Throne of God, will be cast down; and you shall reign over him, in the Light, and Life of the Lord of Glory; and so become the free born Sons and Daughters of the ever living God; members of the Church of the first born, who are redeemed from the Earth, and on whom the ends of the World is come, that in newness of Life through faith, you may live, which will make an entrance through all that would vaile, into the holy City, new Jerusalem, where there is no curse, neither is the Gates shut day nor night; for there is no night, as you in the powerful word of faith, reign over your dark thoughts, doubts and accusings, which did benight you; but now fighting the good fight of faith, the enemy will be kept forth of your habitations, and you will see your right to the Tree of Life, which stands in the midst of the Paradise of God, there to feed, and grow Pillars in the Temple of the Lord; and
shall go no more forth, but as you have received Christ, so to walk in him, and as you are overcome with the glory of his pure love, and constrained in the overcoming life, to offer up sacrifice of prayer, exhortation or praises in the Assemblies of the People of the Lord, or in your own Families you are to be faithful, for the least mite of the returns of his own spirit is acceptable to him, so every one minister according to the aboundings of the manifold Grace of God, and let not any from this liberty be hasty to utter words before the Lord, least they be found intruders, and have their reward with them as is before written in this Epistle, who are the troubles of the Heritage of God where ever they come, yet notwithstanding what they do; let not the dear Children of the Lord be unfaithful when you are moved in the forcible power of the Word of the Lord, which is as a fire and a hammer that breaks the R • cks in pieces, and layes all in the dust before the Lord within you, be you faithful and keep in the bounds and limits of the pure savoury spirit of Life, that so we may all be as a Family of Prophets, and as Assemblies of living Ministers from the highest stature to the least babe born again Immortal of the seed of God, in whom the spirits of the Prophets is subject to the Prophets, and every Member in the pure life will know their service in the body, the strong leading the weak by the hand, and in all attainments of the gifts of God, denies and girts up self, to serve one another in pure love, which is known in the inward Man, the washing one anothers feet, and here is Christ and his Disciples, and the Lord really known to be one and his name one, which binds up in the Eternal Unity of the Spirit and bond of peace, being all cloathed with the Wedding Garment, sitting at the Table of the Lord, eating his flesh, and drinking his blood; so we being many are one bread in Christ the bread of Life, and he binds us up in the one Garment, his own Righteousness, where there never was rent, nor never will, because our head, who commands and governs the Members of his body, is the Prince of Peace, and therefore Peace he gives unto us, which the World knows not, neither can they take it from us, let every one read that can understand their lot to be in this Inheritance, and there to abide to the end of their days, that an Eternal Crown of Glory may remain with them here, and for ever when time shall be no more: And all you my honourable Brethren and Sisters in the Lord, who
travel in the strength of his pure peaceable Spirit to gather the scattered of the House of Israel, the Glorious Presence of the Almighty God prosper you in your undertakings, who often leaves the ninty and nine that kept their state with God and in the unwearied spirit, labours to bring in the souls that is driven away, and when they will submit to the Word of the Lord, oh how do you bear their burdens, and brings them again with joy and triumph with the host of Heaven; who rejoyces more over one that was lost, but now found, and brought again, then over the ninty and nine that need no repentance; for you with me knowes assuredly they that turn a sinner from the error of his wayes, saves a soul from death, and hides a m • ltitude of sins; therefore shall you shine as Stars in the Firmament of Heaven, abiding faithful in gathering many souls to God▪ Righteousness, in whom feel my life with you in the forcible unity in this spirit of our beloved: Oh the Lord encrease the number of you, dear pre • ious, ever honourable Brethren and Sisters in whom this pure peaceable spirit of our beloved reigns, my soul blesses the name of the Lord for you that ever you had a being amongst the Children of Men, for you are the Chosen of the Lord from the least to the highest stature, for to stand saviours upon mount Zion this day, wherein the Lord is making up his Jewels whom he hath prepared to endure the trial of this suffering day, which ten years ago I was sent to proclaim in your ears, that all might prepare to meet the Lord when it should speak forth it self as in some measure it hath done, and now doth, to awake all to walk in newness of life, to reign over the spirit of this world, and all the pomp and glory thereof, and so to dwell in the established life, there to be hid in the hollow of the hand of the Almighty God, as in a munition of Rocks in this dreadful and terrible day of the Almighty God, wherein all hearts will fail, but whose confidence is in the Lord alone, and waits in the Resurrection of the Royal seed to be kept out, over, and above all things that would provoke the eyes of his glory, that so in close union every soul may be kept in the bosom of the Lord of life, the husband of the bride, the Lambs wife; for whom the eternal, everliving, glorious majesty, God over all, hath determined to appear as he hath done, so will he more and more, for
the help of his helpless People, whom he hath chosen to trust in him before the Sons of Men, and hath given victory to overcome, in washing their Garments, and making them white in the blood of the Lamb, therefore stand they before the throne of God praising him day and night in his holy Temple, over all the wrath and cruelty of Men; therefore all Chosen of the Lord look up to the Lord, who will plead our cause in the face of all People; for Michael the great Prince spoken of by Daniel the Prophet, will stand up and deliver them whose Names are written in the Lambs Book of Life: Oh let us trust in Him, and give up all to Him, for he will astonish the People as much as ever he did in any Generation, when he arises in his dreadful vengeance to plead the cause of his own Church, which he will preserve, and who finish in the way their faithful Testimony, the Crown of Glory is their reward for ever; but a remnant there is who shall see the Lord bring to nought all the wicked devices of the enemies of God in this Nation, whom he will pour his vengeance upon, that they shall curse the day that ever they afflicted the Innocent 〈◊〉 of the holy God, whose confidence is in the Lord alone; yea, it makes my eyes to be watered with tears in the deep sence of the great Calamity that will come upon those that seek to destroy the People of the most high God; Oh vengeance, terrible vengeance from the Lord our God will be poured forth, that shall cause all hearts to fail that withstand the rising of his Glory, and they shall gnaw their tongues for pain, in the anguish of their souls, untill they set free the Redeemed of the Lord, and give them liberty to serve their God in the Land of their Nativity.

And this my God hath commanded me once more to declare unto you dear suffering Lambs of my Heavenly Father, for he is mighty to save, and will not let any sufferings come upon us, but he will give us ability to rejoyce through, over, and beyond all that the power of da • k • ess can do, for he will cause the Earth to shake, and the hearts of the People to fail, and all Nations shall know he is our God, who will manifest his power txo the sight of our enemies, that not any weapon formed against us
shall ever prosper, or tongue lifted up, but it shall fall in Judgment, which the Lord will perform in his own time, the mouth of the Lord hath spoken it.
Through your Brother and Companion in the Kingdom of patience and tribulation in the Lord Jesus, where my life is bound up with you for ever.

closer.dateline: Given forth from the Spirit of the Lord in the common Goal in Warwick the 27. day of the fifth Moneth 1666.
